snippet: The attack on two brothers in Baghlan Province, which left one of them in a coma, was the latest in a series of assaults on members of the Afghan news media.
abstract: Gunmen attack two journalists in Kabul, latest in string of assaults on members of Afghan media; motive for unclaimed attack remains unclear, though authorities detained one assailant, who apparently has family connection to victims.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and AHMAD SHAKIB
byline.contributor: Najim Rahim contributed reporting from Kunduz, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The attack on two brothers in Baghlan Province, which left one of them in a coma, was the latest in a series of assaults on members of the Afghan news media.

headline.main: 2 Radio Journalists Attacked by Gunmen in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: 2 Afghan Radio Journalists Are Attacked by Gunmen
